title.rendered: Israel Aid and Humanitarian Efforts in Gaza: June 25, 2024

content.rendered:
Humanitarian Aid Update – June 24

Aid Trucks Entry

On June 24, a total of 299 humanitarian aid trucks were transferred to Gaza. The breakdown of this transfer is as follows:

  • 240 trucks via the Kerem Shalom crossings
  • 12 trucks via the maritime route (JLOTS)
  • 47 trucks via the Erez West Crossing

Aid Collection

Only 165 aid trucks were collected on the same day. The details of the collections are:

  • 70 trucks collected from the Erez crossing
  • 95 trucks collected from Kerem Shalom by the private sector

As of June 24, the contents of 1,200 aid trucks remain waiting for collection from the Gazan side of Kerem Shalom. Additionally, over 6,376 pallets of aid are waiting to be collected from the JLOTS offloading area.

Jordanian Route

On June 24, 46 aid trucks entered Gaza via the Jordanian Route.

Fuel Updates

One tanker of fuel and six tanks of gas, which are designated for the operation of essential infrastructure in Gaza, were successfully delivered on June 24.

Maritime Route (JLOTS)

A total of 12 aid trucks were offloaded from the JLOTS on June 24.

Medical Evacuations

To date, 3,331 injured and sick individuals, along with 754 escorts, have been evacuated from the strip.

Medical Teams

A convoy of medical teams from the UAE entered Gaza on June 24.

Coordinations

Out of a total of 47 general coordination requests, 40 (85%) were approved. All 17 UN requests were approved, with 13 requests taking place and 4 canceled by the requesting agency, as of June 24.

Local Tactical Pause

Today, June 25, between 10:00 and 14:00, the IDF will pause operations in the Al-Batishi neighborhood in Khan Younis to enable the movement of humanitarian aid.

excerpt.rendered: 299 aid trucks entered Gaza; medical evacuations and fuel supplied.
